title: How to Use Kool Aid Creatively

steps.headline: Clean your dishwasher.
steps.description: Lemonade Kool Aid can be used as more than a tangy drink––it can also be put to a second use as a dishwasher cleaner. The citric acid content in it will remove iron stains and lime build-up from inside a dishwasher, leaving it nice and clean for the next round of washes.

steps.headline: Dye your hair.
steps.description: If you'd like to experiment with a different hair color but don't want to make a long-term commitment or use harsh chemicals, there are some "home remedies" that do the trick. This article will show you to dye your hair with Kool-Aid drink mix powder. The color will last several washings, and your hair will even smell a bit like the flavor used (temporarily).

steps.headline: Make lip gloss.
steps.description: With a sweet smell and taste, this one is always a hit with the teen girls and young adults. It's an ideal gift for a birthday or Christmas.

steps.headline: Make Kool Aid popsicles.
steps.description: With the addition of Kool Aid, this happens to be the best and easiest treat you could ever want on a hot summer day!

steps.headline: Keeping on the ice cold theme, make Kool Aid ice cubes.
steps.description: These cubes can be added to a variety of drinks to improve the flavor.

steps.headline: Make your own snow cone syrup using Kool Aid.
steps.description: Making snow cones is a delicious way to treat the summer blues. This easy syrup flavoring will make complete the homemade snow cone treat.

steps.headline: Make Kool Aid wine.
steps.description: It's fun and an extremely easy way to make cheap but drinkable alcohol. It won’t replace a nice beer or wine, but it's perfect for occasions where you need plenty of cheap alcohol. Drinkable after about 2 weeks, it does improve greatly after 3-4 weeks.

steps.headline: Make Kool Aid play dough for the kids.
steps.description: This is a fun way to make homemade play dough with the lingering scent of Kool Aid. This easy recipe can be made in 15 minutes and it's non-toxic.

steps.headline: Make gummy bears.
steps.description: These delicious gel treats are much improved in flavor by the addition of Kool Aid.

steps.headline: Keep the Kool Aid packages and make a Kool Aid purse.
steps.description: They're a little different and a great way to reuse your waste instead of throwing it away.
